title: Avio and Arianespace Finalize Divorce Terms
summary:
During the 2023 Space Summit in Seville, European Space Agency member states agreed to allow Avio to market and manage the launch of Vega C independent of Arianespace. The Vega family of rockets are developed and manufactured by Italian rocket builder Avio. However, a prerequisite for the company receiving ESA funding to develop the launch […]
The post Avio and Arianespace Finalize Divorce Terms appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: EU finalizing contract with SpaceX for Galileo launches
summary: The European Union is in the final stages of completing a deal with SpaceX to launch four Galileo navigation satellites in 2024.

title: Virgin Galactic lays off staff as it focuses on next-generation suborbital vehicle
summary: Virgin Galactic said it will lay off staff and cut expenses to conserve resources for its next generation of suborbital spaceplanes.

title: Space Force procurement chief to ‘double down’ on reforms
summary: Asked if he is having second thoughts about his proposed tenets, Frank Calvelli said he would double down on these reforms.

title: Lynk Global starts initial direct-to-device services in Solomon Islands
summary: Regional mobile operator bmobile has started using Lynk Global’s direct-to-device satellites to extend coverage to more parts of the Solomon Islands, a 70,000-person nation northeast of Australia.

title: SpaceX readies for 80th launch of the year
summary: SpaceX is targeting its 80th mission of the year tonight with the launch of a Falcon 9 from Cape Canaveral Space Force...

title: ArianeGroup to Receive €340M Per Year to Operate Ariane 6
summary:
Member states of the European Space Agency have committed to provide ArianeGroup with up to €340 million a year to operate Ariane 6. In addition to subsidies for Ariane 6, it was also agreed that €21 million per year would be provided for the operation of Vega C. ESA is currently working towards a major […]
The post ArianeGroup to Receive €340M Per Year to Operate Ariane 6 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Daily Telescope: Pumping up the volume with the Headphones nebula
summary: "I liked the object so much I decided to give it a try."

title: Getting inflight Wi-Fi up to speed
summary: While growing demand for Wi-Fi on planes is a significant growth opportunity for satellite capacity providers, the pandemic has held back its upward climb alongside a decline in air travel. However, the inflight connectivity (IFC) market is preparing for some major lift as air traffic fast approaches pre-pandemic levels.

title: ESA: Time to Assert Europe’s “Rightful Place” in Space
summary: The ministers of the European Space Agency’s member states today committed to a “paradigm shift” in the European space program and “asserting Europe’s rightful place in the world.” Meeting as […]
